project.description: The Manatee Deploy job is used to deploy a working manatee application onto a manatee environment. This job is typically run after the Manatee Environment job. In order to use this job for deploying a Manatee application, enter in the same value you used for the "STACK_NAME" when running the Manatee Environment job into the "STACK_NAME" parameter in this job. Jenkins will do the rest! Lastly to check your end application, go to your browser and enter in HOSTNAME.oneclickdeployment.com/wildtracks (HOSTNAME should be the parameter that you used in the Manatee Environment job)

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
cd ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/ cap setup stack=${STACK_NAME} key=/usr/share/tomcat6/.ssh/id_rsa
sed -i "s@manatee0@${APPLICATION}@" ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/features/deployment.feature
host=`ruby ${WORKSPACE}/lib/showback_domain.rb --item ${STACK_NAME} \ --key InstanceIPAddress`
cucumber ${WORKSPACE}/deployment/features/deployment.feature host=${host} user=ec2-user key=/usr/share/tomcat6/.ssh/id_rsa
sns-publish --topic-arn $SNS_TOPIC \ --subject "Application Deployed" \ --message "Your Application has been deployed successfully. You can view it by going to http://$host/ This instance was deployed to by $JENKINS_DOMAIN" --aws-credential-file /usr/share/tomcat6/aws_access
